description: End users may notice unauthorized access or compromised user credentials in systems running Windows 10 and Windows 11 after installation of the security updates KB-5033379, KB-5033375, KB-5033372, and KB-5033369. These updates address CVE-2023-36004, where a man-in-the-middle attack can result in the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive data or user credentials. The impacted Windows builds include 10.0.10240.20345, 10.0.22000.2652, 10.0.19045.3803, and 10.0.22631.2861, meaning users may experience disruptions or unauthorized access if the updates are not applied promptly.
